title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online
notes:
To get DX11 to work, you'll need to do the following in a terminal (WINEDIR should be the location of your proton install, which may not necessarily be $HOME if you installed to another drive. The same applies to WINEPREFIX)


WINEDIR="$HOME/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/common/Proton 3.7/dist"
export WINESERVER="$WINEDIR/bin/wineserver"
export WINELOADER="$WINEDIR/bin/wine"
export WINE="$WINELOADER"
export WINEDLLPATH="$WINEDIR/lib/wine:$WINEDIR/lib64/wine"
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/pinned_libs_32:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/pinned_libs_64:/usr/lib32:/usr/local/lib:/usr/lib:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/i386/lib/i386-linux-gnu:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/i386/lib:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/i386/usr/lib/i386-linux-gnu:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/i386/usr/lib:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/amd64/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/amd64/lib:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/amd64/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:$HOME/.local/share/Steam/ubuntu12_32/steam-runtime/amd64/usr/lib"
export WINEPREFIX="$HOME/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/compatdata/39210/pfx"

wget  https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Winetricks/winetricks/master/src/winetricks
chmod +x winetricks 
./winetricks xact d3d11=native dxgi=native xaudio2_7=native


If the launcher doesn't work, you'll need to go to the install directory of the game, the default of which is "$HOME/.local/share/Steamsteamapps/compatdata/39210/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/My Games/FINAL FANTASY XIV - A Realm Reborn/" and edit the line "BrowserType" in FFXIV_BOOT.cfg from "0" to "2".

If, after choosing your server, you get a black screen with a throbber/loading icon in the bottom right that doesn't go away, you'll need to edit a file in the same directory named "FFXIV.cfg" and change "CutsceneMovieOpening 0" to "CutsceneMovieOpening 1".

Note that (at least on Mesa 18.3.0-devel LLVM 8.0) you will be unable to play in true fullscreen. Borderless fullscreen works without issue on Maximum Settings, however. You may also need to supply a launch option "PULSE_LATENCY_MSEC=60 %command%" in the steam properties if you get crackly audio.

title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online
notes: Error at Launch: "A system error has occurred: 404 HTTPS System Error

title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online
notes: After installing the game through steam you gotta run the run.sh script (google ff14+Proton). However on some Distros like Linux Mint and Ubuntu you'll have to add a # before "export WINEPREFIX" since it won't work. The game will then launch and run pretty good (30 fps less then Windows).

Downloaded Winetricks normally, then ran in Terminal with "WINEPREFIX=*Steamdir*/steam/steamapps/compat/39210 winetricks"  This method may require Wine be installed alongside Proton, but will work regardless of other factors whereas the method mentioned in the other report can bork your Steam directory.  Use Winetricks to install xact and set dx11, dxgi, and xaudio2_7 to Native.  Edit FFXIV_boot.cfg to browsermethod=2 and FFXIV.cfg CutsceneOpeningScene=1.
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Ivybridge Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
notes:
DX9 only.
If the launcher doesn't work, you'll need to go to the install directory of the game, the default of which is "$HOME/.local/share/Steamsteamapps/compatdata/39210/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/My Games/FINAL FANTASY XIV - A Realm Reborn/" and edit the line "BrowserType" in FFXIV_BOOT.cfg from "0" to "2".

If, after choosing your server, you get a black screen with a throbber/loading icon in the bottom right that doesn't go away, you'll need to edit a file in the same directory named "FFXIV.cfg" and change "CutsceneMovieOpening 0" to "CutsceneMovieOpening 1".
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online

notes:
Simply follow the steps in on the "Final Fantasy 14 (FFXIV) Steam Play Proton DXVK Tutorial" YouTube video. (https://youtu.be/zfGpdgESyn4)

Access your FFXIV.cfg and change "Screen Left & Screen Top" to 0. 
Screen Width and Screen Height to your respective resolutions. Save it. And You're Fucking Golden.
systemInfoNotes: Make sure if you install Manjaro, use the non-free drivers.
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online

notes: After some tweaks like shown in the video (https://youtu.be/zfGpdgESyn4) the game started perfectly and totally smooth. After the initial settings I played multiple dungeons and even PvP. Honestly I couldn't even tell that I'm running on Linux right now. Gold Status worth it
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online

notes: Works flawlessly after the tweaks described in the video below, which amounts to making two single line config adjustments and winetricks.  Ran several dungeons and story quests without a hitch in borderless windowed mode with two monitors.
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online

notes: Followed the same tutorial mentioned on here prior, and now everything works great! Runs just as fast as it did on Windows!
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online

gpu: ATI Technologies Inc. AMD Radeon RX 480
notes: Use Protontricks to install XAct, and set DX11, DXGI, and XAudio2_7 to Native.  Find FFXIV_Boot.cfg and open in your favorite text editor, set BrowserType=2.  Launch once, exit immediately.  Find FFXIV.cfg, set CutsceneMovieOpening=1.  Over the course of long playsessions it starts dropping frames until it becomes unplayable, or audio crackles can start (this latter is a Windows issue, though much less frequently.)  Do a client reset between raid instances to avoid nasty surprises.
title: FINAL FANTASY XIV Online
